title: Remote Phone Terminal & Utility
excerpt: Using Termux, Tailscale, and SSH to create a remote phone utility player from a PC with an API for notifications and TTS.
author: Codem
content:
Project Overview

I've had Termux on my phone for quite a while, installed via F-Droid, along with some other tools. Oh boy, I didn't know what was coming my way.

I began experiments with SSH, HTTP requests, and Tailscale and ended up with something I did not quite expect. I ended up making something of a remote phone player from my PC that auto boots with Termux-booter and Tailscale.

Technical Utility

Then I realised I could make a full notification system, audio player, and TTS (Text-to-Speech) player API for my computer to use. This makes my phone a potent, accessible utility from my desktop.

It became quite the project and I might be connecting it to project Echo:Ava later for things like reminders, inter-device communication, and smart home control. It's a rather interesting discovery of a tool and a rather powerful one as well.

I will continue to experiment and see where it gets me. You can check out my portfolio to see more of my current projects.
